data.title: beer
data.text: I realize this is a wine store. however, more people would patronize if they weren't so hard headed about serving popular beers. most all they have is odd ball.

data.title: Slow Sandwich, anyone?
data.text: Been here many times and a favorite of some friends. A good selection of soups, salads (though all are mayo based...yuck), and sandwiches (also the majority have mayo). Fairly inflexible about ordering (such as hold the mayo), even had friend yelled at about wanting a spoon and extra crackers with the soup....very soup nazi. A nice little eatery that has a great wine selection, great little feel, but the food is ok. With only one person able to take orders and each meal complete before the next is started (even if all ordered the same thing). For simple sammies really takes far too long, though the food does not taste bad but is not that outstanding either. Is there a rating between poor and ok?

data.title: Fantastic!!!
data.text: Just love going here to eat.  Food is fantastic and people are so friendly.  Enjoy going to places I have been going to for years.

data.title: Disappointed
data.text: I visited this restaurant because my friend recommended it.  The food was not good to me and to be honest I was a bit concerned about the look of the place.  I visited this same restaurant a few years back and it was much nicer and cleaner.

data.title: La Bodega delivers relaxing music and wonderful food.
data.text: La Bodega is a quaint eatery nestled near the Hampton waterfront down a side street that offers a relaxed atmosphere and even some piano on certain days. The sandwiches and salads along with fresh made desserts makes LaBodega a place you'll want to try and come back to again and again.

data.title: Great selection of wines.
data.text:
Nice place for lunch inside or outside. Great customer service.
Friday afternoon wine tastings and an occasional band appearance.
Owner quite helpful in selecting and pairing wines, great selection of beers.

data.title: 3 owners later and still doing great
data.text: Was the ooriginal Wine St Gourmet, has had about 3 different owners and it is still doing great, Cheers!!!

data.title: Great for Lunch
data.text: We used to come here two or three times a week. thaey had great sandwiches and at least a couple of Soup choices. There were several types of bread you could have along with fresh vegetables and sandwich meats and cheeses. Their egg and tuna salad was fantastic. They had Dr. Browns soda too, which is my favorite. it's reletivly small with seating at a mix match of tables and chairs for about 40. quite busy at lunch time a lot of city officials go there for lunch. No music blaring, so you can certainly have a quiet lunch.. The one downside is who you get to take your order, most of the girls are great, but they have one guy who is just mean, like the soup Nazi on Sienfeld. he just doesn't like anyone- But the food is great!

data.title: Hampton Wine
data.text: Stopped in to unwind after work Friday.  The Greek salad, red wine beef stew, and bottle of red Cotes du Rhone 90+ paired perfectly.   On Fridays they have Free wine tasting 4:30-7:30.   Oh, what a jewel we have in downtown  Hampton.  (Pssssst, if you are a wino like me, you must stop in at least once.  Great prices for a sit-n-wine!

data.title: Great Lunch Spot
data.text: I had the opportunity to visit the LaBodga with my co-worker on a rainy and chilly afternoon. The atmosphere is wonderful and the staff was great.  I will definitely visit again.

data.title: "THE" PLACE IN HAMPTON FOR A GLASS OF WINE!
data.text: A very unique bistro in Hampton. Food selection is limited by design since the available choices in the evening (the only times we've been) are really to help soak up a bottle of the extensive selection of great wines with friends. We haven't been there for lunch yet, but I understand La Bodega is really popular with downtown Hampton workers. Occasional live music just makes it that much better!

data.title: Quaint place
data.text: Met up with friends for a wine tasting. It's an unusual place whereas you can buy food products and they will ready them for you. For instance, we bought cheese and crackers. They cut it up for you and bring it out on a platter. The servers could not be any kinder. Great place to meet up with friends.

data.title: Really Good Sandwiches
data.text: This is one of those places that I always think of after the fact when trying to find a place to eat.  I finally made it downtown in April and was very glad that I did.  It was one of the better roast beef sandwiches that I've ever had.  The bread was very good and you could tell the meat was quality.  It is a very eclectic place.  They offer various kinds of wine and beer for sale.  They actually have a very good selection of each.  If you are near downtown for lunch, stop in.  You won't be disappointed in this place.

data.title: Nice Atmosphere, great food
data.text: Really enjoyed my time in this cafe. Really nice food, sandwiches, good coffee, but for me it was the friendly staff that made the visit worthwhile. Happy smiling demeanour. Highly recommended

data.title: Deli-cious Sandwiches
data.text: La Bodega is a small deli that caters to downtown Hampton residents/workers as well as to the boat crowd from the marina behind the Crown Plaza Hotel several blocks away.  Expect a variety of overstuffed sandwiches and a choice of homemade salads which can be carry-out or eaten in the restaurant.  La Bodega is off the beaten path.  There is free parking across the street.  Good value food.

data.title: Great local gem!
data.text: I live very near to this establishment.  Enjoy large sandwiches on yummy fresh bread during the week for lunch.  Friday and Saturday evenings La Bodega stays open late.  Get a chilled bottle of wine or beer and either sit inside (there's even a couch in the back near wine), or sit outside on covered patio.  Dog friendly -- we  bring our dogs Friday and Saturday evening and enjoy the nice breeze coming from the water about a block away.
